result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jodi Lynn Burt

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
8:53 AM Defendant Jodi Lynn Burt in court. Attorney Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) for the Defendant. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date. DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint. Court enters not guilty plea to misdemeanors. Atty Pollak states the DEF might qualify and requests a status conference for eligibility. Atty Pollak requests time limits for preliminary hearing to be waived. Court sets a status conference. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on January 24, 2023 at 11:00 am.

Initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Reprinted for DEF at window.
PFAC Petition of Appointment of Attorney

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

Burt, Jodi Lynn    CASE:  H22100202

Possession of Methamphetamines
Bail/bond hearing on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:15 AM DE Jodi Burt in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appears by video. Kenneth Sortedahl  appeared by video for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak no objection.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for 11/1/2022 at 8:30AM.

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
